claim: The Great Wall of China is visible from the Moon.
correction: The Great Wall is not visible from the Moon with the naked eye.

claim: Lightning never strikes the same place twice.
correction: Lightning can and does strike the same place multiple times.

claim: Humans only use 10% of their brains.
correction: Humans use virtually all parts of the brain over time.

claim: Goldfish have a three-second memory.
correction: Goldfish can remember things for months.

claim: Bats are blind.
correction: Bats can see, and many also use echolocation.

claim: Vikings wore horned helmets.
correction: Historical evidence shows Vikings did not wear horned helmets.

claim: Mount Everest is the closest point on Earth to space.
correction: Mount Chimborazo’s summit is closer to space due to Earth’s equatorial bulge.

claim: Sugar causes hyperactivity in children.
correction: Studies have not shown sugar to cause hyperactivity.

claim: Camels store water in their humps.
correction: Camel humps store fat, not water.

claim: Vaccines cause autism.
correction: Extensive research shows vaccines do not cause autism.

claim: The Sahara is the largest desert on Earth.
correction: Antarctica is the largest desert.

claim: Eating carrots improves night vision dramatically.
correction: Carrots help maintain eye health but do not grant exceptional night vision.

claim: A duck’s quack doesn’t echo.
correction: Duck quacks do echo.

claim: Humans have five senses only.
correction: Humans have additional senses like balance, temperature, and proprioception.

claim: Shaving makes hair grow back thicker.
correction: Shaving does not change hair thickness or growth rate.

claim: Penguins live at the North Pole.
correction: Penguins live in the Southern Hemisphere, primarily Antarctica.

claim: Bulls hate the color red.
correction: Bulls react to motion, not the color red.

claim: Dropping a penny from a skyscraper can kill someone.
correction: Air resistance prevents a penny from becoming lethal.

claim: Napoleon was very short.
correction: Napoleon was around average height for his time.

claim: Chameleons change color to match any background perfectly.
correction: Chameleons change color mainly for communication and temperature regulation.

claim: You should wait 24 hours before filing a missing person report.
correction: Authorities can be contacted immediately when someone is missing.

claim: Humans evolved from modern apes.
correction: Humans and modern apes share common ancestors but evolved separately.

claim: If you touch a baby bird, the mother will abandon it.
correction: Most birds will not abandon chicks due to human scent.

claim: Black holes suck everything like vacuums.
correction: Objects must cross the event horizon to be trapped; outside, gravity follows normal rules.

claim: All deserts are hot.
correction: Deserts can be cold, such as Antarctica and the Gobi.

claim: You can see the Great Wall of China from low Earth orbit easily.
correction: The Great Wall is difficult to see unaided from low Earth orbit.

claim: Bananas grow on trees.
correction: Bananas grow on large herbs, not trees.

claim: Sugar dissolves faster in cold water than hot.
correction: Sugar dissolves faster in hot water.

claim: Earth has only one moon.
correction: Earth has one natural moon but occasionally has temporary mini-moons.

claim: Ostriches bury their heads in the sand.
correction: Ostriches do not bury their heads; they may lower them to the ground when threatened.

claim: Coffee stunts your growth.
correction: No evidence shows coffee stunts growth.

claim: Cracking knuckles causes arthritis.
correction: Cracking knuckles is not linked to arthritis.

claim: Houseflies live only 24 hours.
correction: Houseflies typically live weeks to a month.

claim: Everest is the tallest mountain from base to peak.
correction: Mauna Kea is taller from base to peak when measured from its ocean floor base.

claim: Seasons are caused by Earth being closer to the Sun in summer.
correction: Seasons are caused by Earth’s axial tilt, not distance to the Sun.

claim: Tomatoes are always vegetables.
correction: Botanically tomatoes are fruits; culinarily they are treated as vegetables.

claim: Glass is a slow-moving liquid.
correction: Glass is an amorphous solid at room temperature.

claim: Humans and dinosaurs lived together.
correction: Non-avian dinosaurs went extinct about 65 million years before humans appeared.

claim: Dogs see only in black and white.
correction: Dogs see limited colors, mainly blues and yellows.

claim: Plants get most of their mass from soil.
correction: Plants gain most mass from carbon dioxide in the air.

claim: Einstein failed math as a student.
correction: Einstein excelled in math from a young age.

claim: Toads give you warts.
correction: Warts are caused by viruses, not toads.

claim: The Moon is made of cheese.
correction: The Moon is made of rock and metal.

claim: Space is completely empty.
correction: Space contains particles, radiation, and fields, though very sparse.

claim: If food drops, it’s safe if picked up within five seconds.
correction: Contamination can happen instantly regardless of time on the floor.

claim: Brown eggs are more nutritious than white eggs.
correction: Eggshell color does not determine nutritional content.

claim: Sharks can smell a single drop of blood miles away.
correction: Sharks have keen smell but not to that extreme distance.

claim: Microwaves cook from the inside out.
correction: Microwaves heat food by exciting water molecules unevenly from the outside inward.

claim: Humans have four blood types only.
correction: There are more than four blood group systems; ABO with Rh is just one.

claim: Bamboo is a tree.
correction: Bamboo is a grass.

claim: Earth is larger than all other planets in the solar system.
correction: Jupiter and Saturn are much larger than Earth.

claim: All snakes are venomous.
correction: Most snake species are non-venomous.

claim: Poinsettias are deadly if eaten.
correction: Poinsettias are mildly irritating but not deadly to humans.

claim: Diamonds are rare.
correction: Gem-quality diamonds are common; rarity is market-managed.

claim: Birds will reject eggs touched by humans.
correction: Most birds will continue to incubate eggs despite human scent.

claim: Antibiotics kill viruses.
correction: Antibiotics target bacteria, not viruses.

claim: An octopus has nine hearts.
correction: An octopus has three hearts.

claim: Black belts always mean mastery.
correction: Belt meanings vary by martial art and school; black belt is not universal mastery.

claim: A coin flip is always a 50/50 outcome.
correction: Real flips can be biased by technique and coin design.

claim: Humans can’t breathe and swallow at the same time because of size.
correction: The epiglottis mechanism, not size, prevents simultaneous breathing and swallowing.

claim: Spinach is extremely high in iron because of a decimal error.
correction: Spinach has modest iron; the decimal error story is itself a myth.

claim: Babies are born without kneecaps.
correction: Babies have cartilage that later ossifies into kneecaps.

claim: Car batteries last indefinitely if unused.
correction: Car batteries self-discharge and degrade over time.

claim: Copper is magnetic.
correction: Copper is not ferromagnetic.

claim: Alcohol warms you up in cold weather.
correction: Alcohol dilates blood vessels, making you lose heat faster.

claim: Humans glow in the dark visibly.
correction: Humans emit faint bioluminescence not visible to the eye.

claim: Oxygen is the most abundant element in the universe.
correction: Hydrogen is the most abundant element in the universe.

claim: Earth’s core is hollow.
correction: Earth’s core is solid inner and liquid outer layers, not hollow.

claim: All clouds are white.
correction: Clouds can appear gray or black depending on thickness and lighting.

claim: A year is exactly 365 days.
correction: A year is about 365.2422 days; leap years adjust for this.

claim: Michelangelo painted the Sistine Chapel ceiling lying down.
correction: He painted mostly standing on scaffolding.

claim: Bulls are enraged by red capes only.
correction: Movement of the cape, not its color, provokes bulls.

claim: The human tongue has distinct taste zones.
correction: All taste buds can detect multiple tastes, not strictly zoned.

claim: Coffee beans are beans.
correction: Coffee beans are seeds of the coffee berry.

claim: Earth is perfectly round.
correction: Earth is an oblate spheroid, slightly flattened at the poles.

claim: Lightning never strikes airplanes.
correction: Airplanes are struck by lightning and are designed to handle it.

claim: Peanuts are true nuts.
correction: Peanuts are legumes.

claim: All spiders spin webs.
correction: Many spiders do, but some hunt without webs.

claim: You can get a cold from cold weather.
correction: Colds are caused by viruses, though cold weather can influence exposure.

claim: Great Barrier Reef is dead entirely.
correction: The reef is threatened and partially damaged but not entirely dead.

claim: Sugar substitutes have zero calories always.
correction: Some substitutes have minimal calories; labels may round down.

claim: All bacteria are harmful.
correction: Many bacteria are beneficial or harmless.

claim: Earth is the center of the solar system.
correction: The Sun is at the center of the solar system.

claim: Whales are fish.
correction: Whales are mammals.

claim: An earthworm cut in half becomes two worms.
correction: Usually only the head end may survive; two full worms do not form.

claim: If you swallow gum, it stays for seven years.
correction: Gum passes through the digestive system in days.

claim: Deserts have no life.
correction: Deserts host diverse adapted life.

claim: All stars are yellow like the Sun.
correction: Stars vary in color and temperature.

claim: Solar panels store energy.
correction: Solar panels generate electricity; storage requires separate batteries.

claim: Metal spoons cool down hot drinks quickly.
correction: They conduct heat away slightly, but the effect is small.

claim: Vitamin C prevents all colds.
correction: Vitamin C may slightly reduce duration but does not prevent all colds.

claim: Earth’s gravity is zero in orbit.
correction: Gravity acts in orbit; objects fall continuously creating weightlessness.

claim: All octopuses have eight hearts.
correction: Octopuses have three hearts.

claim: Honey spoils quickly.
correction: Honey can last indefinitely if sealed properly.

claim: Polar bears eat penguins.
correction: Polar bears live in the Arctic; penguins live in the Southern Hemisphere.

claim: A tomato is a root vegetable.
correction: Tomatoes are fruits that grow on vines above ground.

claim: Humans can see in complete darkness after adjusting.
correction: Without light, humans cannot see; adaptation only improves low-light vision.

claim: Stonehenge was built by Romans.
correction: Stonehenge predates Roman Britain by millennia.

claim: All tides are caused solely by the Moon.
correction: Tides are influenced by both the Moon and the Sun.

claim: Microbes cannot survive in extreme heat.
correction: Extremophiles thrive in very hot environments like hydrothermal vents.

claim: Coins thrown in fountains are retrieved by no one.
correction: Many places collect and donate or process fountain coins.

claim: Spicy food causes stomach ulcers directly.
correction: Most ulcers are caused by H. pylori bacteria or NSAID overuse.

claim: Water conducts electricity perfectly.
correction: Pure water is a poor conductor; impurities carry current.

claim: Earth’s atmosphere is mostly oxygen.
correction: Earth’s atmosphere is mostly nitrogen.

claim: An eclipse happens every month.
correction: Eclipses are less frequent due to the Moon’s orbital tilt.

claim: Ants are lazy workers.
correction: Ants are highly organized and efficient for their colonies.

claim: A day is exactly 24 hours.
correction: A mean solar day is about 24 hours; it varies slightly.

claim: Hand dryers are always more sanitary than paper towels.
correction: Some studies show paper towels can reduce bacteria spread more effectively.

claim: All mammals lay eggs.
correction: Only monotremes like the platypus and echidna lay eggs.

claim: Cacti require frequent watering.
correction: Cacti are adapted to infrequent watering.

claim: Water boils at 100°C everywhere on Earth.
correction: Boiling point varies with atmospheric pressure and altitude.

claim: Alligators and crocodiles are the same.
correction: They are different species with distinct traits and habitats.

claim: Chess can always be won with perfect play.
correction: With perfect play, chess is believed to be a draw.

claim: Lightning only strikes during rain.
correction: Lightning can strike outside rain, including dry lightning.

claim: All fossils are bones.
correction: Fossils can be imprints, casts, or traces; not only bones.

claim: Alcohol kills all germs instantly.
correction: Alcohol can reduce many germs but not all, and needs proper concentration/time.

claim: Water going down a drain spins opposite ways in hemispheres always.
correction: Drain direction is dominated by basin shape and flow, not the Coriolis effect at that scale.

claim: Owls can turn their heads full circle.
correction: Owls can rotate heads about 270 degrees, not 360.

claim: Black cats are bad luck.
correction: Black cats are not inherently linked to luck.

claim: You can charge your phone faster in the freezer.
correction: Cold slows battery performance and is harmful; it won’t charge faster.

claim: All metals are solid at room temperature.
correction: Mercury is liquid at room temperature.

claim: Birds sleep while flying always.
correction: Some birds can sleep unihemispherically during long flights; many do not.

claim: Vitamins replace the need for food.
correction: Vitamins supplement diet but do not replace the need for food.

claim: Wearing glasses worsens eyesight over time.
correction: Glasses do not weaken eyesight; they correct vision.

claim: All icebergs are white.
correction: Icebergs can appear blue or even green depending on structure and algae.

claim: Sushi means raw fish.
correction: Sushi refers to vinegared rice; toppings may or may not be raw fish.

claim: Mosquitoes are attracted solely to light.
correction: Mosquitoes are attracted to CO2, body heat, and odors more than light.

claim: Memory foam remembers forever.
correction: Memory foam slowly returns to shape; it doesn’t store memories.

claim: All rainforest soil is rich and fertile.
correction: Many rainforest soils are nutrient-poor; nutrients are mostly in biomass.

claim: Candles burn without oxygen.
correction: Combustion requires oxygen; a candle goes out in an oxygen-free space.

claim: Chocolate causes acne directly for everyone.
correction: Diet’s effect on acne varies; chocolate alone isn’t a universal cause.

claim: Earthquakes happen only on land.
correction: Many earthquakes occur under oceans on tectonic boundaries.

claim: Hermit crabs make their own shells.
correction: Hermit crabs occupy discarded shells from other animals.

claim: All plastics are non-recyclable.
correction: Many plastics are recyclable, depending on type and facilities.

claim: Planes dump toilet waste mid-flight routinely.
correction: Toilet waste is stored and disposed of after landing.

claim: LED bulbs contain mercury like CFLs.
correction: LED bulbs do not contain mercury.

claim: Bluetooth is named after a color technology.
correction: Bluetooth is named after Harald Bluetooth, a Danish king.

claim: A leap year happens every four years without exception.
correction: Century years must be divisible by 400 to be leap years.

claim: Sharks must keep moving or they die from lack of oxygen always.
correction: Some sharks can pump water over gills while resting.

claim: Rainbows are full circles visible from the ground.
correction: From the ground we see an arc; from above, rainbows can appear circular.

claim: Oil and water always separate immediately.
correction: Emulsifiers can keep oil and water mixed temporarily.

claim: All fire extinguishers work the same way.
correction: Different extinguishers use water, foam, CO2, or chemicals for specific fires.

claim: Boiling removes all microbes instantly.
correction: Boiling reduces microbes but may require time to ensure safety.

claim: Starfish are fish.
correction: Starfish (sea stars) are echinoderms, not fish.

claim: Mars is red because of hot lava.
correction: Mars is red due to iron oxide dust.

claim: Rain always comes from gray clouds only.
correction: Rain can fall from various cloud types, often appearing gray due to thickness.

claim: Humans cannot digest any fiber.
correction: Humans cannot digest fiber for energy but it aids digestion and gut health.

claim: Earth’s magnetic poles never change.
correction: Magnetic poles drift and have reversed many times in history.

claim: Thunder occurs first, then lightning.
correction: Lightning occurs first; thunder is the sound following it.

claim: A compass points to true north always.
correction: A compass points to magnetic north, which differs from true north.
